data.title: The Two Mrs. Carrolls; A Play in Three Acts by Martin Vale [pseud. of Marguerite Veiller]: Very Good (1938)
data.meta_description: George Allen & Unwin Ltd, London - 1938 - Condition: Very Good - London: George Allen & Unwin Ltd, 1938. Stated Second Impression. Octavo; 95 pp. followed by one page of advertisements. Bright orange wrappers with text in black. Covers show some general smudging and a bit of rubbing at spine ends. Opens easily between gatherings but binding is holding soundly. Pages clean and unmarked. Overall, a nice copy of a scarce work later adapted as a movie of the same name starring Humphrey Bogart. - The Two Mrs. Carrolls; A Play in Three Acts
data.text:
Terms of Sale:

We guarantee the condition of every book as it's described on the Abebooks web sites. If

you're dissatisfied with your purchase (Incorrect Book/Not as Described/Damaged) or if the

order hasn't arrived, you're eligible for a refund within 30 days of the estimated delivery

date. If you've changed your mind about a book that you've ordered, please use the Ask

bookseller a question link to contact us and we'll respond within 2 business days.

Shipping Terms:

Orders generally ship via USPS within 1-2 business days in new, sturdy boxes.

For International orders: the default average shipping weight on AbeBooks is based upon a 2.2 lb (1 kg) package, so heavier books or sets will often require extra postage. Feel free to contact us for estimates. Customs declarations will clssify the contents as Merchandise, described as "Book (used)" and valued at the book's purchase price (sans shipping).
